intro: Decaloba rufa, commonly known as the red-stemmed thistle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has spiny leaves and produces purple to pink flowers that bloom in the summer. Decaloba rufa typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
